reviewText: I really loved this movie.  Before sharing it with younger children I would watch it first so if they want to know why the aunt has a cold heart towards her nephew in the beginning of the movie you can have a clearer understanding how to respond to it.  So often we forget hardships can turn people bitter and cold because that dark cloud has never left as so warmly stated in movie Loves Abiding Joy #4 of the Love Comes Softly Series (which are my ultimate favorite movies).  Having come from a hard life myself if I hadn't had a loving home and God in my life I too could have turned out differently.  We are a product of our neutering or lack of it; in most cases.  Sometimes I forget that we aren't promised a life without hardships as this movie shows but how we learn to grow from our adventures; that, with trust and forgiveness you can find your way back.  "Love" can soften even Jane Seymore the cold hearted aunt.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We and our two Alaska Huskies settled down during a chilly November night in the Heartland to watch the movie which simply presented a story on an isolated but lovely island with just a few humans and some beautiful wild horses.  Nothing high tech and absolutely no long car chases!The movie met all our expectation --story of a young boy sent to his aunt who works with the horses on the island. His family has a lot of problems and fighting, and one can only hope the quiet island, the aunt and the horses can heal his pain.But there are glitches, even in the island environment. The boy tries to learn what his aunt (the ever beautiful Jane Seymour) is like and what she expects from him. Also the very simple life, compared with the city.There is only one other character with any real time in movie ---the wilderness bureaucrat, played by Charles Martin Smith. (He's older than his wilderness bureaucrat in "Never Cry Wolf," but still feisty.)The horses are in the background for a while, and then an orphaned foal grabs at the boy's heart, and we wondered if all that built up might come crashing down.Watch the movie, with any pets you might have. You will all enjoy it.Earl
summary: Bonding with wild horses and different generations
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a good story about family and love.  The boy in the story has lost his mom and his aunt takes him to live on an island with her where she is responsible for caring for wild horses.  During a hurricane, a mare is killed leaving her filly alone.  The other horses shun the filly and the boy finds her and begins to care for her. But it causes problems with is aunt and the game warden.  The boy learns how to trust again and his aunt learns how to love again.

reviewText: I live in Boulder, Colorado and on March 19,2005. I rented the DVD movie of Touching Wild Horses staring Jane Seymour. I enjoyed the movie and all the horses.But what got me was the way the Aunt started out, rough and un caring but with a little help from a boy and a horse foal named John.The Aunt saw for  herself that being caring and opening up does more then acting rough and uncaring. I really also enjoyed the views of Sable Island.

reviewText: A boy is sent to live with his Aunt.  He has not seen her before and they have to begin a relationship.They are on an island that she is always struggling to keep her rights to stay there.  The govt would like her off the island.  They have a warden on the island and he checks on her all the time.  BUT the other occupants of the island are wild horses.  They are the reason she is there.  The horses are legislated for in a heavy way. They are not allowed to be touched, fed, ridden.  They are not supposed to have any interaction with humans.  But the woman and boy are building a relationship of love slowly.  She has a secret past where she had a child and it was taken from her and adopted because she was and unwed mother.  She has chosen the horses to be her family but the boy sneaks her heart too.  A horse is drowned on the shores of the island by the rubbish nets fishermen leave.  But the horse has a foal that is alive and needs feeding and care.  The law says it should have to live or die.  That would be legal but the boy decides it is not right.  So they enter into a secret relationship of caring for the horse and setting it free when it can survive with the herd.Touching Wild Horses is a very touching tale.  The acting is so good.  Jane Seymour is her usual beyond comment  perfection.  The boy is very good too.  But the horses are  out of this world.  Not typical anything but very, very beautiful.

reviewText: It's called "Touching Wild Horses" with Jane Seymour.  Kinda like a Hallmark movie, you know, no bad language, no sex, no nudity just a good story and good acting.  It's about a boy who goes through a very traumatic event and gets sent to an aunt he doesn't know to live on an island that has wild horses. I'm sure you've seen the same thing before in another movie, but this one is worth seeing!!
summary: Touching Wild Horses is Worth Seeing!!

reviewText: Jane Seymour, Aunt Fiona a lonely reclusive life on a beatiful Island distrupted by a young 12 year old . lots of family emotions , both aunt and Mark learning to cope with each other and straining the relationship with the treasure hunting park ranger who's self centered on being the only one to stay on the island. the glue a small herd of wild pony horsesthat live on the island and by law should not be touched with human hands.Of course Mark breaks that rule as he is adjusting to seeing nature ,and a young colt thats lost his mother , surival ,from the compassion of a young boy , who through his lost helps the colt to live and helps his aunt fiona to find her family love ,faith , compassion for family.A very good movie to help all the family to see relationship between people and nature. worth seeing and putting in your library for those cold family monents that need stirring up with love.Luddy
Title: N/A

reviewText: Jane Seymour delivers another great performance in "Touching Wild Horses"-a somewhat different role for Jane who often appears in period films. Living alone on an island with wild horses, she suddenly acquires a young boy to care for. During the course of the film Jane mellows from her visibly hard exterior to a caring and loving individual. She accurately portrays and obeys all the rules (well, almost all) as they relate to the protected wild horses. She has clearly taken the time to verify all the details to be sure what she says is accurate (as she did in the Dr. Quinn series). The film was shot on Sable Island (off the coast of Nova Scotia) and information on the island can be found on the Internet. As a collector of Jane Seymour films, this film rates high on my list but not as high as "Somewhere In Time" and the Doctor Quinn series. Try it you'll like it!
summary: Jane Seymour In a different role and great!
